name: Sicilian Style Steak
author: BOBBYR1
summary: Any good cut of steak breaded with a mixture of bread crumbs and Parmesan cheese. You can use tenderloin fillet or porterhouse too.
ingredients: 1 cup Italian seasoned dry bread crumbs
directions: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Stir the bread crumbs, Parmesan cheese, seasoned salt, and garlic powder together in a shallow dish such as a pie plate
Pour the olive oil into a separate shallow dish
Dip the t-bone steaks in the olive oil on both sides; allow excess to drip off
Press the steaks into the bread crumb mixture, and place onto the prepared broiler pan
Bake on the middle rack in the preheated oven until the steaks have cooked to your desired degree of doneness, about 15 minutes for medium
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 140 degrees F (60 degrees C) for medium
